so in the course of owning switch cars
calm and being marginally interested in

also collected a few domain names for

I've gotten offers on a few of them but
probably the most interesting was on a
domain that I own which is cars for
starz.com
and I had originally purchased this
domain early on into my venture into the
car business I had started switch cars
kind of as just a locating service and
help with people buying cars and while
save you money and things like that
because I figured that was the the best
value proposition and really the only
thing I had to offer as a young kid
getting into the car business because
what else did I know so once I started
flipping allocations there was a market
disparity between I'm gonna save you
money and I'm gonna rip you off so I
couldn't really have the were selling
allocations for huge premiums on the
same website as well try to save you
money on your car purchase it was it was
a different client based different
business model and all that so I bought
cars for starz.com and had a fancy
website made and you know the
allocations I had for sale up there and
it actually worked quite well was
selling allocations for Range Rovers and
Porsche gt3 s and BMW m6 is I sold a
couple of those when they came out and
m5 and all sorts of stuff like that
the website has been dormant for a
number of years and just you know
redirects traffic to switch cars because
it got out of the allocation flipping
business for a number of reasons and
just kind of have everything under one
roof now a number of years ago
I got an email out of the blue and said
hey would you sell cars for starz.com
and if so for how much I said well it's
not really for sale which was partially
true but also when you're trying to be a
shrewd negotiator then nothing is for
sale I don't know make me an offer I'll
think about it yes no no just tell me
what you would take for
not playing that game it's not for sale
you approached me so it's your move so
he says well I'll give you five hundred
dollars I'm like nope that's not even a
realistic offer for some domains it
could be but I thought this one had more
value and I thought it was kind of an
insulting offer for somebody who had
reached out out of the blue he said okay
well what would you sell this for now he
was not being a very shrewd negotiator
he was playing his cards at how badly he
wanted it so I said okay well I'm gonna
actually look up and see who this guy is
and why he wants it so badly now
initially I thought man if this guy
offers me like five grand I'll take it
like who cares I'm not using it anymore
that's a good offer
but then I started looking him up and I
found out that he was a young
entrepreneur in the UK and he owned cars
four-stars Co UK and cars four stars net
and his business was online booking for
limo service he had taken over the
market with such authority that
basically anyone who booked a hired car
in the UK went through his service
because he had bought up all of his
competition he had bought up hundreds if
not thousands of domain names and he'd
actually been buying up limo companies
as well so not only did he own the
bricks and mortar of a lot of these
companies the ones he didn't own he was
getting a cut off of the booking and
there was a recent article about how he
had paid multiple six figures for this
big group of domain names he was very
smart with SEO or his team was at least
and they would create hundreds of
websites with the right text and the
right links and you know create this big
web of links so there was tons and tons
of websites to book limos through but
they were all his websites and he was
awarded some you know entrepreneur the
Year thing something rather but you know
it was very clear that he was spending
big bucks to acquire all the domains
possible and while dot-com is seen as
the domain to have in the US it's not
necessarily seen that way in the rest of
the world because you know
every country has their own extension
and all that but you know he had dotnet
he had Co I knew he wanted dot-com
because you're not anything if you don't
have dot-com so I'm like alright this
guy really wants it I'm just gonna throw
back an equally ridiculous offer to his
$500 initial offer
so I countered at 325 K which you know
it's not worth that but I knew that I'm
just like okay well you got to start
somewhere so he got all pissed off and
was like that's a crazy offer it's not
worth that you're dreaming I'm like yeah
you're right but so was $500
so let's now that we've both established
that were smoking crack let's try to
meet somewhere in the middle so he comes
back at 5 grand I think I would have
taken that if you started with that but
now that I've done all my research and
found out how much this domain is
potentially worth to you I want to try
four more so I countered it I don't know
maybe 50 or 75 grand something like that
and in the course of discussions I had
reached out to my attorney and just said
hey you know what advice do you have on
negotiating on this and a couple other
items and he kind of said if if he gives
you like 10 grand take it and walk and
that was kind of my feeling as well I
knew to get him there I had to you know
given his his aggressive negotiation
from the get-go I knew I had to play it
back to him the problem was he decided
that he deserved to have this domain and
after I sent my second counteroffer he
got very aggressive and just said you
know what if you don't take it for 5
grand I'm gonna sue you and we're just
gonna own it because I own the trademark
or copyright or whatever for that phrase
I don't I don't think you realize who
you're dealing with
like I'm no domain special attorney
whatever but I know my way around the
ICANN rules and stuff like that and I
had actually in in my research of him I
had looked up lawsuit that he had filed
against another company and it was
copyright infringement now this other
company was a direct competitor of his
in the UK and they were booking limo
services and they had literally copy and
pasted the text from his website onto
theirs so obviously he had handily won
that but what he was trying to say was
that he had copy written the phrase cars
for stars I'm like you can't copyright
the phrase that's not how that works so
he was trying to tell me that he was
going to sue me for the domain and
pointed me to this similar suit that he
had done against this other company I'm
like wow it's too bad for you I've
already done my research that was an
obvious copyright infringement and this
has nothing to do with copyright this
would be a trademark issue if anything
and even with a trademark it doesn't
cross country lines and it doesn't cross
industry lines you're in the limo
business I'm in the car sales business
and we're in two different countries so
you can have your trademark over there
it doesn't affect me over here like
you're not Walmart you don't have the
rights to that name you can't take it
from me in court and he just responded
you'd be surprised what our lawyers can
do it was just like you know okay sure
sounds like a whole bunch of posturing
and I'm just like listen you're being
ridiculous
it's gonna cost you at least $25,000 to
even start this lawsuit if you were
actually going to file it which I know
you're not because of people who yell
the loudest never back it up I'm like
just why don't you just offer me that
you guys know we're gonna take it from
you like okay cool
well discussions are over I'm not
dealing with you like I don't even want
to sell you the domain name anymore like
if you had just been nice and offered me
five grand up front it would have been
done but you had to play the I've got
bigger nuts than you card
I emailed him back maybe a few weeks
later and just said hey listen let's
start this conversation over make me a
reasonable counteroffer but if the word
attorney lawyer anything like that comes
up discussions are completely over and
he just he couldn't help himself he
immediately went back to oh well look at
this up this other guy we had offered
and he didn't take it and we just took
it from him in court and it only costs
us three grand so ha ha ha don't be like
that guy and I'm like no you didn't know
you didn't but whatever he just he
couldn't help himself so I let it go and
I guess I was a little bit disappointed
because at this point I'd certainly
rather have the $5,000 than a domain
name that I'm not using anymore but it
is what it is and he actually reached
out to me I think just a like last year
he sent me another email and said hey
you know I don't know if you remember me

or my team had expressed interest in

remember you and you know we're still
interested do you have a number that

down the same road that we went before
and just be reasonable and you know he's
like that's not worth that you know the
most we could possibly pay is $2,500 and
I'm like okay well it doesn't interest
me
rarely do I sell something for less than
I've previously been offered by the same

while I'd like to say that my pride
